title: 109_s765
content: The Act may be cited as the "Math and Science Incentive Act of 2005". Congress finds that the United States must enhance its scientific and technical enterprise by producing more scientists and engineers. The education system needs to promote the study of science and mathematics to address the lagging performance of U.S. students in these fields compared to international peers. The United States needs to recommit to leadership in science, mathematics, and engineering, especially as advances are being made in areas like nanotechnology. A program of loan forgiveness is designed to attract students to pursue careers in these fields. The United States should prioritize leadership in science, mathematics, and engineering, particularly in nanotechnology. Loan forgiveness programs can attract students to careers in these fields, helping maintain technological leadership. Establishment of program. The Secretary will implement a program to cover interest payments on loans for eligible undergraduate students who have applied in accordance with the requirements. The program covers interest payments on loans for eligible undergraduate students who have applied in compliance with specific requirements, including being a new borrower and a teacher in STEM fields at an elementary or secondary school. The program covers interest payments on loans for eligible undergraduate students who are teachers of science, technology, engineering, or mathematics at an elementary or secondary school, or are mathematics, science, or engineering professionals, and agree to complete 5 consecutive years of service in that position. The Secretary will not make payments for interest that do not meet specific criteria. The program covers interest payments on loans for eligible undergraduate students who are teachers of STEM subjects or professionals in STEM fields. To qualify, individuals must complete 5 consecutive years of service in the designated position. The Secretary will not make interest payments that accrue before the repayment period begins or before the agreement is signed. The program covers interest payments on loans for eligible individuals who are teachers of STEM subjects or professionals in STEM fields. Participants are selected based on national security, homeland security, and economic security needs of the United States. The program covers interest payments on loans for eligible individuals selected based on national security, homeland security, and economic security needs of the United States, as well as academic record or job performance. The program covers interest payments on loans for eligible individuals selected based on national security, homeland security, and economic security needs, as well as academic record or job performance. Eligible applicants may be chosen based on the likelihood of completing the 5-year service obligation and remaining in science, mathematics, or engineering after fulfilling the service requirement. Loan interest payments under this Act are contingent on appropriations. If funds are insufficient, priority will be given based on specified criteria or other relevant factors determined by the Secretary. The Secretary will prioritize interest payments for qualified applicants based on previous fiscal year payments. The Secretary has the authority to create necessary regulations. The Secretary will pay interest on behalf of selected student borrowers for a period starting from the agreement's effective date, continuing after service completion, and ending upon loan repayment completion, $10,000 payment, or borrower's service cessation. The borrower's service obligation will end when the loan repayment period is completed, the Secretary pays $10,000 on behalf of the borrower, the borrower fails to fulfill the service obligation, or the borrower's income exceeds 4 times the national per capita income for 6 months. The borrower's service obligation will end when the loan repayment period is completed, the Secretary pays $10,000 on behalf of the borrower, or the borrower's income exceeds 4 times the national per capita income for 6 months. Repayment to Eligible Lenders is subject to regulations prescribed by the Secretary. The Secretary will pay the interest that accrues on a loan of a student borrower selected under subsection (a) to eligible lenders. Eligible individuals must submit a complete application for loan interest payment to the Secretary. Each eligible individual selected under subsection (a) must submit a complete application for loan interest payment to the Secretary, including an agreement to repay the amount if they fail to complete the required service. The application must include an agreement to repay the Secretary for any interest paid on behalf of the individual if they fail to complete the required service. Consolidation loans may only have interest paid under this section to a certain extent. Consolidation loans may have interest paid under this section only if the loan amount was used to repay specific types of loans under the Higher Education Act of 1965 or Federal Direct Stafford Loans. Borrowers are prevented from receiving double benefits. No borrower can receive benefits under both this section and certain other loan forgiveness programs for the same service. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Education, and "mathematics, science, or engineering professional" is defined as someone with a degree in science, mathematics, or engineering working in a related field, including as a professor at a higher education institution. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal year 2006 and the following 5 years is provided under this Act.
